channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How CEOs can stay clear-eyed during the stock market’s AI selloff
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: How to Use Psychology to Pitch Your Next Big Idea
item.description: When you pitch an idea, you’re not just conveying information. You’re guiding someone through a shift in beliefs.

item.title: 3 Different Types of Customers Brands Should Target Now
item.description: Widespread cultural and technological shifts have changed customer buying habits.

item.title: AI browsers need the open web. So why are they trying to kill it?
item.description: For those of us who earn a living publishing content on the open internet, Amazon’s lawsuit against AI startup Perplexity can seem darkly amusing. Per...

item.title: Navy Secretary warns workers can make more at Amazon instead of building America’s warships: ‘It’s hard to get that person to want to do that job’
item.description: The industry contributes $37.3 billion to GDP, but has been outshined by China in recent years.

item.title: Retailers are quietly changing their return policies. Here’s what to know
item.description: ’Tis the season for giving—and that means ’tis the season for shopping. Maybe you’ll splurge on a Black Friday or Cyber Monday deal, thinking, “I’ll j...

item.title: ‘A deadly confluence of wrong-way news’ is what’s causing the global market selloff, says top economist, and don’t expect it to get better anytime soon
item.description: Hopes for an interest rate cut from the Fed are fading despite a global slowdown and a spike in the VIX.

item.title: Nvidia’s earnings could answer the AI bubble question and upend global markets in moment of truth for Magnificent 7
item.description: A historic capex surge, thin AI revenues, and extreme index concentration leave investors one disappointment away from a broad‑based equity shock.

item.title: What if your next personal trainer were an AI agent?
item.description: When the new year rolls around, many people will resolve to get in better shape. Last year, Americans poured $44.8 billion into the fitness industry, ...

item.title: Big 5 AI ‘hyperscalers’ have quadrupled their use of debt to fund operations, Bank of America says
item.description: All five companies companies generate more than enough cash to cover their operations but the arrival of debt vehicles to fund AI has complicated the ...

item.title: She Switched Her Gender on LinkedIn and Page Views Grew by 400%. There Could Be Other Reasons, Too
item.description: Megan Cornish flipped her profile to ‘male’ and got five times more page views. That one change might not tell the whole story.

item.title: This fan sneaks scents into your sleep to improve your memory
item.description: It looks like nothing more than a bedside fan. To program it, you hit the “on” button once. But what happens next could improve your memory by 226%. T...

item.title: Nvidia Earnings Will Make or Break the Stock Market
item.description: The AI trade hinges on lofty expectations for the world’s largest company.

item.title: Bitcoin ‘Death Cross’ Worries Investors as Crypto Prices Keep Struggling to Gain Ground. Here’s What That Means
item.description: After strong growth throughout much of the spring and summer, the world’s most popular cryptocurrency is now roughly flat for 2025.

item.title: This famous golden toilet, once offered to Trump, just sold at auction for $12.1 million
item.description: A 220-pound, fully functional, solid-gold toilet—once offered to President Donald Trump as a satirical gift—just sold at a Sotheby’s auction for $12.1...
